text: My name is Jean-Louis Quéguiner.
I’m the CEO and Founder of Gladia,
a French company specializing in speech recognition.
We have two main customers, two main types of customers.

The first is what we call meeting recorders. You probably 
see them in your meetings.
And the speciality of these systems is to take notes
and then produce summaries using artificial intelligence
to synchronize CRM, to improve customer knowledge

and to improve team efficiency with automated 
meeting reports and so on.
And the second type of customer we have are contact centers,
And their speciality is to improve the quality of customer relations,
to increase the efficiency of agents by recognising
in real time names, surnames, e-mails, addresses, et cetera.
And to synchronize this with CRM or other systems such as suppliers.

In general, a voice recognition system will be 
based on frequency management.
We use generative AI.

We listen to the sounds that are happening and try to 
match phonetics with dictionaries.
So, we understand the deeper meaning of the audio, unlike traditional systems which are just a system of phonetic correspondences.
What attracted us to the AWS product portfolio was its ability to supply GPUs in large quantities, particularly at peak times.
This is one of the big issues today, the ability to deliver GPUs for a huge number of cloud providers.
So this flexibility is just incredible. The second is the ease of orchestration thanks to SageMaker.
SageMaker is an incredible product that lets you scale up and scale down to optimize costs, but that's not all.

Managing a GPU is very complicated. These are machines 
that heat up a lot,
they can break without any real warning,
and the whole SageMaker system enables us to deal with all these hardware problems automatically, without having to worry about them.

Thanks to Activate credits, we were able to explore 
various Amazon products.
And the first one that caught our attention
was Cognito, a security suite for user authentication.
Security is not something that we want to deal with directly.
For specialized products, we want to delegate it to specialists.

And so Cognito was the first product we explored. 
The second was for storage reliability.
The third product we used was SageMaker.
And the last one,
is Inferentia, the most specialized inference product from AWS.
High performance at a relatively low cost.
What surprised us most about AWS, in our experience, was that
despite the fact that it's a huge machine, we have extremely bright people in front of us, people who are extremely empathetic,
who are there to find solutions

When we arrived in the United States, as a French start-up, 
there was an inevitable lack of visibility.

And so being able to associate ourselves with a brand 
as strong as AWS to talk to customers
makes a huge difference in discussions and in discovering the market.
Today, 80% of our sales are based there, and 50% of our customers are based in North America.
